title: How to properly nerf Riven's obnoxious escapes without touching her ability to fight or jungle
body:
http://i41.photobucket.com/albums/e294/kingbiff/Valor_zpsjzl0gwjs.png

>TL;DR
>1. TRIPLE the cooldown of her dash from 6 to 18 seconds @ rank 5 (3.6 sec to 11 sec with 40% CDR)
>2. Attacking a champion/minion/monster after dash reduces the dash cooldown back to live numbers (like Gnar boomerang)

~~~~~~~~

>IT'S CALLED "VALOR," NOT "COWARDICE"

Riven's shield provides her with good trade and outplay power.  Though many people consider an AD-scaling shield OP and BS, I feel that it fits her kit.

I am mediocre at Riven and hate facing her, but I do not think that her ability to fight is too strong.

**My main complaint with Riven is her ability to escape a coordinated gank with spammable dashes, many times when she doesnt even have boots and enemies have boots 2**

>How to nerf her cheesy escapes without touching her ability to fight champs or jungle mobs

1. TRIPLE the cooldown of her dash (from 6 to 18 seconds @ rank 5)
2. Using Valor puts a single charge of "VALOR" buff on Riven that does not stack.
3. If Riven hits a champion, minion, or monster with auto attack, immediately consume VALOR buff to refund 66% of the CDR-modified cooldown of the dash, restoring it to current baseline CD (possibly instantly refreshing it)

>Illustration

**Riven NOW:**

Case 1:  Riven uses Valor to fight her enemy.  She goes all-in and gets to use it every 3.6 seconds (40% CDR) in a fight to shield damage and dodge spells, etc

Case 2:  Riven uses Valor to escape a gank.  She gets to dash 375 units every 3.6 seconds, essentially giving her more movespeed than Swiftness boots would, and negating slows.

**Riven WITH THE CHANGE**

Case 1:  Riven uses Valor to fight her enemy.  She goes all-in and gets to use it every 3.6 seconds (40% CDR) because she is fighting and the scaling CD restore means she can use it as often as before as long as she is committed to fighting.

Case 2:  Riven uses Valor to escape a gank.  She dashes once, but since she is running away like Brave Sir Robin, she cannot consume the VALOR buff and thus can only dash once per 11 seconds (40% CDR)

I suggested this ages ago, glad it's finally getting recognition. Not sure why Kennen, Renekton, and Shen have to connect their dash to use it again/get enough energy to use other abilities while Riven can dash 4 times every few seconds. On top of that her shield negates any damage that ranged attacks deal to her while she's running.

I'm not fundamentally opposed to the idea, although I think it's funny how "Riven needs a nerf." is the assumed consensus. I'm still of the opinion that she's a mediocre champion propped up by an absurdly experienced playerbase in a game mode (solo Q) that caters heavily to her strengths.

It's because she has one of the strongest early game dueling and bullying power combined with resourcelessness, a powerful gap closer, and extremely powerful escape. Basically she doesn't trade anything for her early-mid game dominance and safety. This is the perfect solution to keep her as a strong early bully without making her impossible to punish for overextending.

I think you will find Riven's early game dueling and bullying power fairly underwhelming compared to champions like Renekton, Pantheon, Olaf, and Garen. Riven has high early game kill pressure but that kill pressure relies almost entirely on your mistakes. She's also very vulnerable early. 1 bad trade and she doesn't get to farm anymore since she's melee only and her regen is complete shit. 

I get where you're coming from, but it's a solution that removes an intended strength. Riven is supposed to be extremely slippery; that's part of her identity. You could make the argument that she's too strong and could stand to lose some of that intended strength, but you'd have to actually come up with something substantial to convince me of that. A 52% win rate with 148 average games played is nowhere near convincing.

The issue with Riven is that she can force a fight and zone better than any of the strong bruiser/juggernauts while having 100-0 kill pressure. Her biggest issue is that she doesn't know if she's an assassin or fighter. She can massacre tanks, fighters, and assassins alike while still being as slippery as an assassin. Then she turns into absolute crap lategame.

Basically she has the safest and one of the strongest laning phases in exchange for falling off miserably. When there isn't much counterplay to Riven other than "pick Renekton, Olaf, or Garen" that's a pretty big issue. Champions with comparable strength to Riven also have tradeoffs which Riven doesn't. Renekton pushes the wave if he wants to sustain with Q, and is very vulnerable to ganks. Same thing with Olaf, his only sustain involves attacking as quickly as possible and he has no escape. Garen is still pretty overpowered right now so I wouldn't compare him to anyone. 

tl;dr The only champions who are stronger than Riven (early game) have a weakness in the form of ganks, which is the whole point of this thread. Being able to win 1v1s with 95% of champions in the game while being immune to ganks is a major flaw in her balancing.

If you think the only counterplay to Riven is to pick a counter, you're giving Riven far too much credit. You pick those champions to shut down a Riven, but it definitely doesn't mean you're helpless if you don't get one of those champions. I beat Riven with "weak" early laners like Nasus, Mundo, and Yasuo all the time. 

There is something Riven mains will tell you: Every Riven matchup is a skill matchup. And it's true. You can beat or lose to Riven with every top laner you could choose to play. The difference is, due to Riven's enormous following, the Riven player is almost guaranteed to be more experienced in any matchup she finds herself in, which is an enormous advantage. That isn't a Riven problem; that's just a consequence of being such a popular champion with so many mains.

I don't think it's the only counterplay, but it's the only way you can CS without being forced out of lane or killed. Riven will overpower you from level 1 to 18 to 50 minutes in the game if she's been killing or bullying you the entire time. Like I said, her engage and kill potential is just massive. Mundo can farm because of his cleavers and if you're doing okay as Yasuo vs Riven then she is an awful player and isn't being aggressive enough. 

Regardless of skill, Riven's kit gives her the tools to be one of the most severe counters in the game to more champions than anyone else, while being safe from ganks. This is like 90% of the top lane meta being Ahri vs Yasuo.

Except it's not true. You can keep saying it, but that doesn't make it true. Riven's early game is not the unstoppable monstrosity people imagine it to be and you can very easily beat her early with many champions. Yasuo beats Riven for the first 3 levels and starts beating her again once he gets shiv. Mundo actually outtrades Riven at lvl 2 with his E. Irelia wins early trades if she uses her stun at the right time and goes hard if Riven is careless with her CD's. Jax massively outtrades Riven at lvl 1 and can easily leverage that advantage into a free lane. I could give more examples but I don't feel it's necessary. 

Riven has high kill pressure early but she's hardly the dominant early force champions like Renekton and Olaf are. The days of lvl 2 red pot cheese are long gone; If you die to Riven 1v1 in lane at this point, it's because you fucked up, and no other reason.

What are her weaknesses? She has two AOE hard CC, four dashes, sustain from a shield, a large AOE, large range execute + big AD buff + increased range on attacks and abilities + 30 second cooldown with maxed CDR so 50% up-time, a Sheen 3.0 after every spell with no cooldown and can stack, no mana costs, very low cooldowns, very good ratios and damages, etc. 

WHERE IS THE WEAKNESS? Only thing I can think of is range, but she has tons of mobility and CC so good luck kiting her.

She has no poke, no sustain, no instant gap closer, is all AD damage, no ranged farming tool, extremely low damage when spells are on CD, useless when behind, snowball reliant etc. Stop listing things a champion does, that doesn't work.
